title: Help with a name of this font or similar?
content:
Hola,I am new here and I see allot of great ideas here. I have been looking for the name of this font or something similar and for the life of me cannot fond it anywhere. The guy that created the shirt does no longer work at the company that made it so I cannot go there. Any help is appreciated.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [barFEST.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109221142/http:/typophile.com/files/barFEST.gif) | 76.74 KB |
author: Mercury Shadow

comments.content:
Not sure if the image came through but the main font here :D

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109221142im_/http:/typophile.com/files/barFEST_6433.gif)

' [Mojo](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109221142/http:/typedesign.com/fonts/mojo.html)', by [Jim Parkinson](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109221142/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Jim%20Parkinson).  
_(Another alternate may be 'Jonah', from Canada Type, and 'Roller Poster', by Tom Wallace / HiH.)_

Dav(id)

Thank you for the quick reply. Do you think the main logo Font is handmade? I cannot find that one? Thanks

Bear

[Hendrix](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109221142/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/hendrix/) by Scriptorium, is probably related to this lettering, although I don't know which came first.

- Mike Yanega

There's also Keith Bates' [Rick Griffin](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109221142/http:/www.k-type.com/fontrick.html), named after the guy who did a lot of that 60's psychadelic poster lettering. Bates offers a package of three fonts - a background, a thinner overlay and the two combined as Rick Griffin Contour. The latter yields this:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109221142im_/http:/typophile.com/files/RickGrif_4035.jpg)

When you use the letters 'B' 'a' 'r' in Hendrix, you get this. Obviously the same poster lettering was the source of the inspiration for both font designers.

- Mike Yanega

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109221142im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Hendrix_Bar_3515.png)
